column4: im having some trouble with dns on a machine... I can ping ips, but not names... I have the resolv.conf pointed at my router which all of the windows machines are pointed at as well. The windows machines resolve just fine. Its just my ubuntu box. What else besides resolv.conf can I check?
You have something similar to, "nameserver 192.168.1.1" in your /etc/resolv.conf file?
So if you type, "dig yahoo.com" it comes back with no IP response?
Seems like your resolver is not working right.  Let me google a bit...
...or 4.2.2.1 which is a public DNS server.
If you can resolve IPs with that, then it's your router's nameserver configuration.
Any luck with a different nameserver in there?
Did you put, "nameserver 4.2.2.1" in your /etc/resolv.conf file?
Ok.  If that didn't work, then the resolver seems broken.  Either that or your ISP is redirecting DNS queries to their own nameservers.  Perhaps they have a broken nameserver...
What is your ISP's nameserver IP?  (I just need one of them)
They still have nameservers that they are (almost) universally obligated to provide to you.  But whatever...
Have you tried rebooting the CSU/DSU box?
T1 service *always* comes with an SLA.  I'd contact them and have 'em fix it!
I know 'cause I used to have a couple of them.
